description:
Discussion 2

For this discussion, locate a journal article that relates to research ethics in a field of your interest.  Cite in APA format.

Write a 500 word response summarizing your journal article including class lecture information on ethics.

  • Make sure to answer the following questions:
    • What is the ethical issue being covered?
    • Did they receive informed consent?
    • What are the benefits/harms of the research?
    • Are there any privacy concerns with the research?

After making your post, reply to two other students in the class using at least a 100 word response.

  • Do you agree with the original post?  Why or why not?
  • Are there other concerns you would consider, if you were conducting the research?
name: Discussion 2:  Ethics in Research

description:
Final Project Group Formation & Dataset

 

  • Project Team:  List of Group Members
  • Data:
  • Subject Area / Field of Interest
  • Source of Data (provide link to dataset)
  • Specific dataset(s)
  • Dataset Description (# numeric variables, #categorical variables, #sample size, multiple related tables?)
  • Technology planned to Use (i.e. Python, R, SPSS, Tableau, etc.):

                How do you plan to use the technology?

  • Remember the following requirements for datasets and groups:
    1. Group should have # of students.

 

 Class: 5 students per group

  1. Choose 1 liaison student for the group, who can submit assignments and ask me questions on behalf of the group.
  2. Your dataset should be a real dataset with at least 10 to 20 (numeric) continuous/discrete columns/variables.
  3. Dataset with at least 300 rows of observations ( n >= 300 sample size).

Dataset should have at least (10 * #var, but better yet 20 * #var) samples (methods require this for significance/stability).

You will need a large sample size if you have a large n umber of variables.

See me if you have any doubts about your dataset.
name: Final Group Formation and  Research Proposal (Homework Assignment)

description:
Final Group Project Literature Review Draft

 

For this week’s assignment, you will need to locate at least three peer-reviewed journal articles related to your final project dataset using Google Scholar or UIUC Library resources. Your group will need to write an essay in a minimum of three paragraphs (maximum of 6 paragraphs) double-spaced explaining the following:

 

  1. What past research has been conducted in the field or application of your dataset?

• Avoid writing 1 paragraph per source
• See how these different papers are similar and different in regards to your research
• Why is this research significant for your field of study?

 

  1. How does this past research relate to your present study and research questions?
  2. What are your present study research questions?
  3. What do you plan to learn from this study? What are your hypotheses and predictions?

    Remember a paragraph is 5-7 sentences and to cite in APA format for both in text and in a separate Reference page.
name: Final Group Project Literature Review

description:
Assignment 1

Please answer questions in separate paragraphs (5-7 sentences per paragraph) and number your answers.

  1. Explain a concept covered in the first half of the semester and why you found it interesting. 

 

  1. Using the concept mentioned in Question 1, provide a problem/research question that you could answer with the concept for an application of your choice.

 

  1. How would you operationalize your research question (what variables would you collect to attempt to solve/answer your research question)?

 

  1. Would you use a quantitative and/or qualitative research method to answer your research question?  Why would you choose this method(s)?

 

  1. What are some limitations that you could encounter in attempting to solve/answer your problem/research question (conceptually/statistically)?
name: Assignment 1:  Research Methods

description:
Assignment 2



For this week’s assignment, you will be creating a survey on a topic of your choice.  We will be using this survey throughout the rest of this semester for the in-class Labs. The survey will be a self-administered analytical survey.

Survey Requirements
1. Create a short consent form for your survey (minimum 250 words,
maximum 500 words).

2. Create 10 closed-ended survey questions (make sure at least 5 questions are numeric or likert scale types of questions).
a. The remaining close-ended questions can have categorical responses.

3. Make sure to include a section for demographic information, including age, gender, and major.

4. Optional, maximum of 3 open-ended questions.

5. Make sure that the questions would be appropriate to ask your classmates; no sensitive topics.

6. Make sure that your questions would be able to be collected within a class period.
name: Assignment 2:  Surveys

description:
Assignment 3: Quantitative Analysis



Instructions: You will be using the Standard Metropolitan Areas dataset to answer the following questions below.
• Use SPSS or RStudio.
• Submit your answers in a HTML/Word Document/PDF with your output.  Write a paragraph per question (5-7 sentences).
• Explain your answers in terms of the domain application study topic.  Write in complete sentences (DO NOT USE BULLETPOINTS).

Standard Metropolitan Areas Dataset-4.csv

 

        Instructions for Using R or SPSS on UIUC AnyWare (01-03-25)-3.pdf


DATA DESCRIPTION:-
1- land_area : size in square miles
2-percent_city : percent of population in central city/cities
3-percent_senior : percent of population ≤ 65 years
4-physicians : number of professionally active physicians
5-hospital_beds : total number of hospital beds
6-graduates : percent of adults that finished high school
7-work_force : number of persons in work force in thousands
8-income : total income in 1976 in millions of dollars
9-crime_rate: Ratio of number of serious crimes by total population
10-region: geographic region according to US Census
We can see that the regions have 4 values, where:
1 = North-East
2 = North-Central
3 = South
4 = West


  1. Create a visualization and answer the questions below, which will provide an interesting story or insight within this data.

 

  • Who is your audience?
  • What is the domain topic application insight?
  • What does this application insight mean for the audience? Why is it important for the audience to know?

    2. What data cleaning and coding techniques would be required to prepare this data for analysis? Are there any changes you would make about how the data was collected or asked?

    3. What are some limitations of this dataset?

    4. What would be future work or additional research questions we could ask based upon the data provided in this dataset?  Also, include what future research questions from the domain perspective could be asked in future studies?
name: Assignment 3:  Quantitative Analysis

description:
Final Project Methods Rough Draft



Submitted by Group Liaison

In preparation for your final project paper, you will be begin writing a rough draft of your methods section in essay format. Please write no more than one full page essay for your methods section. In the final rough draft, you will have the opportunity to revise your methods section when you finalize your analyses over the next few weeks.

Please provide the following in your output:
1) Research Questions
2) Hypotheses (what do you think will be the answers to your research questions)
3) What variables will you be using to answer your research questions?
4) What statistical methods do you plan to answer your research questions?
5) What programs and packages (with version numbers) do you plan to analyze your research questions?

Please use the following websites to provide guidance on how to write your method section.
6. The Methodology - Organizing Your Social Sciences Research Paper - Research Guides at University of Southern California (usc.edu)

How to Write a Research Methodology in Four Steps (scribbr.com)
name: Final Group Methods-Results Section

description:
Assignment 4: Qualitative Methods


For this homework assignment, we will be focusing on qualitative methods, specifically interviewing and field observations.

Problem 1
Think of a person or subject area that interests you. Taking into account what we discussed the past two weeks, create an interview.

Make sure to consider and explain the following:
1. What is/are topic(s) or research questions(s) the interview is supposed to be addressing?
2. What type of interview would fit your purposes the best for answering your research questions?
3. Where and for how long would you plan to interview the participant?
4. If focusing on a specific topic, how many people do you think you would need to interview to have a well-defined understanding of the topic?
5. Provide your interview questions.
6. Depending upon the participant’s responses, what would be some good follow-up questions to ask?

Problem 2
This week, we have discussed the importance of observation not only as a stand-alone method, but also in other methods, such as interviewing. Take 15-minutes observing a public setting on campus or near to you (i.e., in the quad, library, at a game, coffeehouse, etc.).


Make sure to including the following:
1. What type of participation is your observation?
2. What biases does this participation observation provide?  Explain how those biases relate to your observational study. (See this link for assistance: https://www.visualcapitalist.com/50-cognitive-biases-in-the-modern-world/)
3. Provide your observations of the scene around you.
4. What topics or categories could you list your observations as?
5. What could you learn from your field observation in terms of research? 

 

 

If you are interested in bias, you may find these other links helpful:

Qualitative Research Biases (https://www.editage.com/insights/7-biases-to-avoid-in-qualitative-research)

Biases in Research (https://www.scribbr.com/category/research-bias)

Behavioral Economics Biases (https://thedecisionlab.com/biases)

Biases in Medicine (https://sjrhem.ca/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/CriticaThinking-Listof50-biases.pdf)
name: Assignment 4:  Qualitative Methods

description:
Discussion 3

Each question should be answered in one paragraph of 5-7 sentences.

 

  1. Explain one new concept you have learned about digital research.  Cite in APA format.
  2. How can the concept in Question 1 be used in your field of interest?  What research questions could it answer?
  3. What is generative AI? 
  4. How will generative AI play a role in the future of research?
  5. What other research questions or problems would you want to solve with the concept? Where do you see the field of digital research going in the next 5 years? 

 

Once you submit your post, please respond to at least 2 other students' posts as to whether you agree or disagree with the research questions and future direction of the field?
name: Discussion 3:  Digital Research

description:
Final Project Rough Draft



Submitted by Group Liaison

In preparation for your final project paper, you will be begin writing a rough draft of your methods section in ESSAY form.
1) Submit a rough draft of your final project (Executive Summary) and Journal Article including the following, which will help you prepare your final document. Look to How to Read a Journal Article within the Syllabus folder to assist in writing your journal article.

a. Abstract (250 words)
i. Introductory sentence explaining the research question, which intrigues the audience to continue reading.
ii. A sentence about the methods used.
iii. A sentence or two about the results.
iv. A sentence about the conclusion and how the results tie into the research question and the application of the dataset.

b. Introduction
i. Introduce the study topic and provide necessary background information for the study topic.
ii. Why is it important for the world to know about this study topic?

c. Literature Review
i. Can be combined with the introduction.
ii. Provide any previous literature on the topic, research questions, or methods used to answer the topic related to your research question.

d. Methods
i. The list of the techniques that you are using to analyze your data. Include descriptions of why each topic is appropriate.

e. Discussion and Results
i. For each technique, a preliminary analysis and preliminary results remember to answer your research question.
ii. Plots or visualizations that back up or reinforce your analysis (in journals, they are labeled as figures).
iii. Include a section that describes the common threads that link your analyses. Is there anything that is reinforced by two approaches? Are there any common threads that you are seeing? If your analyses are so distinct that they don’t cross-over like this, what do each add to your understanding of the data?
iv. Limitations of the research / how would you have completed the research differently.
v. Future work that could be conducted on the dataset or the application.

f. Conclusion
i. Final conclusions about the research in terms of the application
g. References
i. In APA format
 APA Format Style Guide for In-Text and Reference Page References (https://owl.purdue.edu/owl/research_and_citation/apa_style/apa_formatting_and_style_guide/index.html)
h. Data Visualizations (Numbered and Titled)
i. Figure 1 Title Here for graphs and charts or Table 1 Title Here for Tables
6. The Methodology - Organizing Your Social Sciences Research Paper - Research Guides at University of
Southern California (usc.edu)

How to Write a Research Methodology in Four Steps (scribbr.com)
name: Final Group Project Rough Draft

description:
Extra Credit Assignment:  Qualitative Methods, Visual Media, and Art Theory

(5 points)

For the extra credit assignment, you will go to the Krannert Art Museum. 

 

The museum (free admission) is open Tuesday through Saturday 10AM-4PM and Thursdays until 8PM.

 

Choose two pieces of visual media (art, drawing, sculpture, etc.). 

 

State the names of the two pieces of visual media, the artists who created them, and their location in the art museum (what gallery and exhibit is the piece from?).

 

In no more than three paragraphs of 5-7 sentences each, provide the following information with a data story:

  • What do you physically see in each visual media piece (think literally)?
  • How do you interpret each piece of visual media (think beyond the literal...think symbolically)?
  • How do both pieces of visual media fit together to tell a data story message?
  • Finally, how did you use qualitative methods to answer the above questions?
name: Extra Credit Assignment:  Qualitative Methods, Visual Media, and Art Theory (5 pts)

description:
Final Project Paper

Each group will write a single ESSAY analysis, but each group member will be contributing to the project related to the technique of their choosing. Group members not completing their fair contribution to the final group project may receive a lower grade than the other members in their group.

The single ESSAY analysis of the group will consist of:

1. Journal Article (Technical Summary)
a. 7 typewritten double-spaced pages (not including tables, figures, and reference
page)
b. Cited in APA Style both in in-text and in reference page
c. DO NOT USE BULLET POINTS (NEEDS TO BE WRITTEN IN ESSAY FORMAT)
d. Write a formal journal article in a clear and organized fashion for a statistically
literature audience including the following sections:

a. Abstract of 250 words
b. Introduction
c. Literature Review (Background on the Application / 3-Peer Reviewed Journal Articles)
d. Methods (see next page for further details)
e. Discussion and Results (also including limitations and possible future work)
Results should be explained in terms of the application
f. Conclusion
Conclusion should be in terms of the application.
g. APA Reference page
h. Tables and Figures (titled and numbered in a presentable format after the reference page)
i. Appendix (include Syntax/Code in a separate document)

Your Methods section should include the steps taken to complete your statistical analyses, which should the following:

  • Mention what research questions your Statistical or Machine Learning Techniques are trying to answer
  • Mention types/groups of variables being used to answer research questions (DO NOT LIST EACH INDIVIDUAL VARIABLE)
  • Mention any transformations or formulas used to create new variables
  • Assumptions of Statistical or Machine Learning Techniques (i.e., linearity, multicollinearity, normality, etc.)
  • Options of Statistical or Machine Learning Techniques, if the method has multiple ways of being answered (i.e., cross-validation, training/testing, 1-sample/2-sample, variable selection, etc.)
  • Where appropriate, provide performance metrics for regressions and machine learning techniques (i.e., R2, Adjusted R2, standard error, Mallow’s Cp, Mean Absolute Error, Mean Squared Error, Root Mean Squared Error, AIC, BIC, accuracy, sensitivity, specificity, Positive Predictive Value, Negative Predictive Value, Precision, Recall, F1-measure, AUC-ROC, etc.)
  • Define Significance (i.e., 1-side, 2-sided p-values)
  • Define Alpha Value (i.e., 0.05)
  • Specify Analysis Program tools, Version, and Location

 

Your Results and Discussion section should include the following:

  • Consider the practical (application) of the results, in addition to the statistical significance.

 

Tips for Final Paper

  • Write a clear and concise paper for the appropriate audience
  • Quote and cite any external sources in APA style format
  • Remember that statistical and methods can take multiple iterations to arrive at a final model
  • Understand that analyses may provide none, one, or more than one solution, specifically in regards to regression and machine learning models
    • If models do not work, explain models tried, why they did not work, and how you attempted to correct issues.
    • If more than one model, compare and contrast the various models and their performance metrics in predicting the outcome.
  • Tables and Figures may take multiple versions, in order to be clear and visually presenting.
name: Final Project Paper
